title: Terminator Elision
goal: Learn which terminators can be safely dropped.

sections.content:
Warm-up (2-3 min)

Pro-bridi review:

mi citka .i do broda = ?

(Answer: I eat. You [eat too].)

New Material (5-7 min)

New Vocabulary

Lojban Place Structure English
fraso x1 reflects French culture French
dotco x1 reflects German culture German

What Is Elision?

Elision means dropping terminators that aren't needed. Most Lojban text omits optional terminators.

Common Terminators

Terminator Ends Often Elidable?
ku sumti Yes, usually
kei abstraction Yes, usually
ku'o relative clause Yes, usually
vau bridi Yes, before .i
be'o be/bei Sometimes

When to Keep Terminators

Keep when ambiguity would result:

lo nu klama kei cu xamgu

vs

lo nu klama cu xamgu

Both work here because cu forces the boundary.

Elision Examples

Full form:

mi djica lo nu do klama kei vau

Elided:

mi djica lo nu do klama

Full form:

lo gerku ku poi barda ku'o cu melbi vau

Elided:

lo gerku poi barda cu melbi

Key Point

Most terminators are elidable when grammar is unambiguous. cu often makes terminators unnecessary.
sections.title: New Material (5-7 min)

sections.content:
Practice (4-5 min)

Exercise 1: Remove Unnecessary Terminators

Simplify:

  1. mi djica lo nu citka kei vau →
  2. lo mlatu ku cu melbi vau →
  3. mi djuno lo du'u do klama kei vau →
Answers
  1. mi djica lo nu citka
  2. lo mlatu cu melbi
  3. mi djuno lo du'u do klama

Exercise 2: Cultural Vocabulary

Translate:

  1. This is French.
  2. Alice is German.
  3. French and German are different.
Answers
  1. ti fraso
  2. la .alis. cu dotco
  3. lo fraso cu frica lo dotco

Exercise 3: When is ku needed?

Is ku needed here?

  1. mi viska lo gerku .i ri barda — ku after gerku?
  2. lo mlatu cu klama lo zdani — ku after zdani?
Answers
  1. No — .i ends the bridi
  2. No — end of sentence

`mi djuno lo du'u do klama kei vau` →
`mi viska lo gerku .i ri barda` — ku after gerku?
`lo mlatu cu klama lo zdani` — ku after zdani?

sections.content:
Conversation Challenge (1-2 min)

Say the elided versions:

  1. Full: mi nelci lo nu sipna kei vau Elided: → mi nelci lo nu sipna

  2. Full: lo prenu ku poi barda ku'o cu klama vau Elided: → lo prenu poi barda cu klama

Today's Vocab

Lojban English
fraso French
dotco German

Elidable terminators:

Terminator When elidable
ku When followed by cu, .i, or end
kei When followed by cu, .i, or end
ku'o When followed by cu
vau Before .i or end

Summary

You learned terminator elision. Most terminators can be dropped when grammar is clear.
